fVisa.title: F Visa Information
fVisa.description: Complete guide for F-1 Student visas

overview.title: F Visa Overview
overview.description: F visas are nonimmigrant visas for students who want to pursue academic studies or language training programs in the United States. The F-1 visa is the most common student visa for full-time academic study.
overview.f1Description: The F-1 visa is for students enrolled in academic programs, language training programs, or vocational programs.
overview.f1Req5: Intent to return to home country
overview.f2Description: The F-2 visa is for dependents (spouse and unmarried children under 21) of F-1 visa holders.
overview.f2Act1: Accompany F-1 student to the U.S.
overview.f2Act4: Cannot work or receive employment authorization
overview.f2Act5: Cannot pursue full-time study leading to a degree
overview.processStep1: Apply and be accepted by a SEVP-approved school in the US
overview.processStep2: Receive Form I-20 from your school
overview.processStep3: Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee online
overview.processStep5: Schedule a visa interview at the U.S. Embassy or Consulate
overview.processStep6: Attend the visa interview with required documents
overview.doc6: Standardized test scores (TOEFL, IELTS, SAT, GRE, etc.)
overview.doc8: Evidence of ties to home country
overview.onCampus1: Up to 20 hours/week during academic term

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about F-1 student visa applications and requirements.

bVisa.title: B Visa Information
bVisa.description: Complete guide for B-1 Business and B-2 Tourist visas

overview.title: B Visa Overview
overview.description: B visas are nonimmigrant visas for persons who want to enter the United States temporarily for business (B-1), tourism, pleasure or visiting (B-2), or a combination of both purposes (B-1/B-2).
overview.b1Description: The B-1 visa is for business visitors temporarily in the U.S. for business purposes.
overview.b2Description: The B-2 visa is for visitors who are traveling to the U.S. for tourism or visiting purposes.
overview.processStep3: Schedule a visa interview at the U.S. Embassy or Consulate
overview.doc5: Evidence of ties to home country

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about B visa applications and requirements.
